ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about color, line, shape and space.
color, formal elements, some painting, spatial art, digital art apps.
I learned more about color, shape, line, different methods used to make art (collage, VR, animation), and many other interesting things!
This course made me think about the art i consume and create in a completely different way
The ability to play around with creatives moves and not just make predictable art
talking about art, articulating what works and what doesn't. exposure to various different mediums

I was given a huge amount of knowledge about facilities available to me through the art program and how to use them. I also was able to explore and play with hugely varying mediums which is an oppurtunity I enjoyed very much.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Honestly, if this course was a little more diligently organized, I feel I would have taken a lot more out of it.
the small group size along with a wonderful instructor and TA provided the perfect learning environment - no complaints.

This course was not very engaging nor interesting. We made very few projects and the projects we made were uninspired. What this class should be is an introduction to the art school facilities. One week, show us the laser cutters, give us swipe access, and then assign a project based on the laser cutter. This project can be small, but what it does is prepare us for making art in future classes using a variety of methods and tools. The next week, show us the printers and assign a project, etc.

This is a great course! I really enjoyed taking it and  I loved the experimentation. The course gives you space to grow as an artist but does not pressure you to find your perfect style or medium. It's very exciting.
everything was amazing - manageable course load in comparison to other courses

Strength: I love how open-ended the assignments were. This was so great. It allowed students to take them in many directions.
Weaknesses: The course felt disorganized; one day we would come in and randomly be doing an artist studio visit. The next we would have a work session. The next we would spend 1.5 hours watching how to use the laser cutter which was not a good use of time because we still were not able to use it on our own. This was an exercise in letting go of control in my life but I do think we could have benefitted from laying out a plan at the beginning of the semester and getting a heads up about when class was going to be different.
I feel like I got OK feedback, but often after crit I wasn't sure what to change or improve to make my art better. Crit was just people saying things they noticed, but nothing bigger picture.
i think more structure would be nice in terms of establishing certain skills and aiming to achieve certain goals, but I did like how open ended the subject matter could be

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you are not an art major and just interested in exploring art generally, I would recommend a more specific art course so you come out of it feeeling you have learned a skill.
probably a requirement - but great for a first exposure to art anyway!
Definitely! This is such a fun class, especially for art majors! Non-majors could also really enjoy the class if they are passionate about making and open to new methods and experiences!
yes!!

I don't think so. As I mentioned above, it felt like so much time was wasted in this class. It would have been great to have more personal feedback as we worked (Bailey the TA was great at this), and to have more of a long-term vision for what we were going to be doing.
Yes, if youre looking for a really chill course. art classes are absolutely about what you put into them
Yes.
